page.title: 19THE CHURCHES 2
page.content: daily. Their aim is to take the monastic life into communities. There are services at St. John's twice every Sunday. Though the monks admit they have a small and elderly group of worshippers. In fact a survey of 100 households carried out in Horsehay and Doseley, showed that church going was virtually non-existent. The third church in the area is St. Luke's church in Doseley. Another red brick building, built originally in 1845, it was converted into a 17 room house in 1981. It is an imposing building overlooking Johnston's pipe works. All three churches were part of that mid-victorian upsurge in christianity. Their present situation reveals the contemporary responses of communities, where christianity has a much more marginal role to play.
